techmeme.title: Applied Digital, which leases out data-center space and has started an AI cloud-computing service with Nvidia chips, raised $160M from Nvidia and others (Asa Fitch/Wall Street Journal)
Federal prosecutors charge a man for allegedly using AI to create hundreds of thousands of songs by fake bands to get $10M in royalties from streaming services (Maia Coleman/New York Times)
New Mexico's AG sues Snapchat, alleging it is a "breeding ground" for predators seeking to collect sexually explicit images of children and extort them (Cat Zakrzewski/Washington Post)
Ant Group launches Zhixiaobao, a standalone AI app to let users facilitate daily tasks such as ordering meals and hailing taxis, and access third-party services (Xinmei Shen/South China Morning Post)
A San Francisco federal judge rules that X must face a class action age bias suit by around 150 older workers who were laid off by the company in 2022 (Daniel Wiessner/Reuters)
